data: PACU Nurse to initiate "Phase I: PACU and PCC (Perioperative Care Centre)" only
Discontinue GENDERSURG Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
If urinary output less than 100 mL over 4 hour
Check wound for bleeding/ hematoma/asymmetrical swelling prior to discharge
Check CWMS (breast tissue); capillary refill, turgor, and symmetry of breast flap
Place patient into surgical garment in PACU
Therapy type: VAC, 125 mmHg, Pressure interval: Continuous
Patient to resume home dilation schedule
No Heavy Lifting | No Strenuous Exercise, for 14, day
Other (please specify), Do not raise arms above the head
PCC Nurse to initiate this phase upon patient's arrival to Perioperative Care Centre (PCC)
Surgeon to assess patient prior to discharge
Patient Discharge Information attached to chart
Leave dressing intact until first follow-up visit
Leave surgical packing insitu until first follow-up visit
Leave drain in until first follow-up visit
Prescription(s) on chart, note on chart
Surgical Drain Education; drain teaching by RN
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Start: Clear Fluid Diet, Adjust/Advance Diet to: General Diet
When drinking well and IV medications are discontinued and condition is stable
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag

Patient to resume pre-operative home medications
